name: Great Dane
metaDescription: Great Danes face bloat, heart disease, and cancer. Compare the best pet insurance for Great Danes—coverage for emergencies, DCM, joint issues & more.
intro: Great Danes are gentle giants with significant health concerns. Bloat is the leading cause of death in the breed, and their massive size leads to joint problems and heart disease. Insurance isn't optional—it's essential for Great Dane owners.
whyInsurance: Great Danes have one of the shortest lifespans of any breed and extremely high rates of serious conditions. Bloat surgery alone costs $7,500+. Most Dane owners will face major vet bills.
mustHave: Emergency surgery coverage — Bloat requires immediate surgery
Heart condition coverage — DCM is common in giants
Cancer coverage with high limits — Bone cancer is prevalent
Unlimited or very high annual limits — One incident can cost $10k+
redFlags: Age restrictions (some stop insuring giants at 6-7 years)

costIntro: Great Danes are among the most expensive breeds to insure. Here's what to expect:

faqs.question: Why is Great Dane insurance so expensive?
faqs.answer: Great Danes have extremely high rates of serious conditions—bloat, heart disease, cancer, and joint problems. Their large size means higher surgery costs. Insurance reflects these elevated risks.

faqs.question: What is bloat and why is it dangerous?
faqs.answer: Bloat (GDV) is when the stomach fills with gas and twists. It's fatal within hours without surgery. Great Danes have the highest bloat rate of any breed—insurance is essential.

faqs.question: Is pet insurance worth it for a Great Dane?
faqs.answer: Absolutely essential. The question isn't if your Great Dane will have major expenses, but when. Bloat surgery alone is $7,500+, and most Danes face multiple serious issues.

faqs.question: Should I consider preventive gastropexy?
faqs.answer: Yes, strongly consider stomach tacking surgery during spay/neuter. It prevents bloat and costs $200-500 when combined with another procedure. Some insurance covers this.

faqs.question: What annual limit do I need for a Great Dane?
faqs.answer: We recommend unlimited coverage or at least $20,000+ annually. A single bloat surgery plus heart disease treatment could easily exceed $15,000 in one year.

finalCta: Great Danes need serious insurance coverage. Compare quotes from top providers and protect your gentle giant today.
